TextEn: Oh, my gosh, they're back? Another room at once, sir, plus a full refund, of course.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Thank you very much. This has been a most unsettling experience.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Sir, our guests are our reason for being.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: This room is unfit for humans. I want another room, and I want a refund for tonight.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Perhaps if you would be kind enough to tell me the problem, sir.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: In a word, cockroaches!
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Oh, no, are they back? I'll give you another room immediately, sir, and a refund for tonight.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Thank you. I'm glad that you don't believe that your guests are liars.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Sir, without happy guests, we are nothing.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: I want to change rooms. In fact, I want a refund for tonight!
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: If you tell me the exact problem, I can be more helpful.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Cockroaches have declared war on my room!
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Allow me to apologize. I'll give you another room right now, and a full refund for tonight.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Thank you for not asking me to collect the roaches in a jar as evidence.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: Sir, only your mother wants to please you more than we do.
Subtopic: Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

TextEn: The front desk told me to ask you for sightseeing advice.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Of course. I'd be more than happy to help. I am, after all, the hotel's concierge.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Concierge? What exactly is that?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: We advise you on where to visit, eat, or shop during your stay here in New York.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Great! So where should I start my sightseeing?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: The Statue of Liberty is always a good place to begin.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I saw the Statue of Liberty on my last visit here. Can you recommend somewhere else?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Hmm. What type of interests do you have?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: In my spare time, I really like to view art and go running.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Aha! Have you been to Central Park or the Museum of Modern Art?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: No, but I've heard a lot about both.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Well, Central Park is wonderful for running. Afterwards, you should head to the Museum to enjoy the art.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Great! That sounds like a plan. Thanks a lot.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I'm sure you'll have a good time there.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I was told to see you about going sightseeing.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: It's my pleasure. I'm the hotel's concierge, at your service.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Concierge? Could you explain that to me?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: We help direct hotel visitors to popular places to visit, eat, and shop.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Very good. So where shall I begin my sightseeing?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I would suggest the Statue of Liberty.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Gee, I've already seen the Statue of Liberty. What about another site?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Let me see. What do you like to do in your spare time?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I really like to run. And I like art.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Well, there you go! Have you ever visited either Central Park or the Museum of Modern Art?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: No, but I've been meaning to.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Well, Central Park is fantastic for running. Then you can go to the Museum to look at the beautiful art.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: That sounds like a great plan. I'll do that.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Enjoy your run and your visit!
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I need some sightseeing advice.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: That's what I'm here for, sir. Every good hotel has a concierge like me.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I don't travel a lot. What exactly is a concierge?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: A concierge helps visitors like you find great places to visit, shop, and eat.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: That's great! So tell me, where should I go first?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I'd suggest that you start at the Statue of Liberty.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: You know, I've already been there. Can you suggest another place?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Maybe. Tell me what you like to do in your spare time.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: When I have some free time, I often spend it running or at museums.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Well, have you ever been to either Central Park or the Museum of Modern Art?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: No, but I sure would like to.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Central Park is great for just about everything outdoors. Then you can visit the Museum of Modern Art.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Both places sound great. I'll try to do that today.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Enjoy the views at both places.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I'm going sightseeing, but I'd like to get your advice first.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I'm only too happy to help. Tourists should always check with their concierge first.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Concierge? I'm not familiar with that word.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: A concierge directs visitors to the city's great tourist, shopping, and eating places.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: That sounds great. Now, is there any place that I should hit first?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Well, if you're like most people, you'll want to go to the Statue of Liberty.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I've already seen it, I loved it, but today I want to go somewhere else.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Sure! Tell me about your interests.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I like to run and I like to see the works of the masters.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: You'll get along fabulously at Central Park and the Museum of Modern Art! Have you been to either?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: No, I just haven't had the opportunity.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: You'll love Central Park for running. Later on, you can go to the Museum of Modern Art.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Thank you. That's what I'll do.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: This might be the best day of your visit.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I need some sightseeing advice. I was told to come to see you.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: As your concierge, it is my pleasure to help you, sir.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Concierge? Are we speaking English here?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: A concierge helps you find all the great places for visiting, shopping, and eating.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: What would you suggest that I visit first?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: How about starting at the Statue of Liberty? Many people like to begin there.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: The last time I was here, I visited the Statue. So do you have another place in mind?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I think so. Tell me what interests you.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I'm big on running, although maybe I like art even more than running.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Then you must go to Central Park and the Museum of Modern Art! Have you been to either one?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: No. I haven't had a chance to go to either of them.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Both places are usually crowded with natives and tourists. You'll love the Park and the Museum.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Thank you. That's great advice.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: This might be the best day of your visit.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Can you give me some advice about going sightseeing?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Your concierge, sir, is the right person to ask when you need sightseeing advice.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: What in the world is a concierge?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: We direct visitors to all the great tourist, shopping, and eating spots in the city.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Then what would you recommend as a starting point for my sightseeing?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Definitely the Statue of Liberty. I think that that is everyone's favorite first stop.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Actually, I've already been there twice. Do you have another suggestion?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I think I can come up with something. How do you spend your spare time?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I keep my body healthy by running and my mind active by visiting museums.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Well, the Museum of Modern Art and Central Park were made for you! Have you gone to either one?
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: No, although I've heard great things about both of them.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: You don't want to miss either place. Central Park and the Museum of Modern Art are big and beautiful.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: Sounds great! I'll get my running gear and then I'm out of here.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: This is a day you're going to remember for a long time.
Subtopic: Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

TextEn: I am here to sign my escrow papers.
I will tell you ahead of time, that there is a lot to sign here, but I will help you every step of the way.
Should I have brought anything with me?
Basically, what I need from you now is your driver's license or some ID that shows your residency status.
Where do I start?
We will be going through these papers one by one. I will be explaining them all to you, and you can ask questions as we go.
Can I make a phone call to a friend if I have a question?
We do not want you to sign any documents that you do not understand. You may get assistance with any questions that you have.
Will the house be mine when we finish these documents?
This is the last thing you need to do, but it may take a while for the papers to be processed.
Your assistant said that it was time to come in and sign my escrow papers.
Don't be intimidated. There is a lot to sign, but I will explain everything to you very clearly.
Do you need anything from me?
All the papers have been drawn up, but I will need to see your picture ID so we can notarize these papers.
There are a lot of papers!
We are going to go through these bit by bit. You will have plenty of time to read the fine print.
My dad is going to be here in a minute to help me go through this with you.
We want you to get any outside help that you need. Do not ever sign documents that you don't understand.
Can I start moving in after I finish signing these documents?
When these papers get processed, the house will be yours!
I am very nervous about signing my escrow papers.
Escrow involves a lot of paperwork, but I will explain all of the steps to you as we go along.
What should I have brought with me?
The only thing I will need to see is your driver's license, as I will be notarizing these papers.
I feel a little overwhelmed by so many papers.
Don't worry about how many papers there are. We are going to look at them one at a time.
My boyfriend is an attorney and told me that I could fax him anything if I had a question.
Please get any outside help that you need in understanding your escrow documents.
Is this the last thing that I will need to do before the house becomes mine?
At the close of escrow, the house will be yours!

I heard that you finished my home inspection, and I was wondering how it went.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: First of all, we need to understand what I was looking for. Do you know what the purpose of an inspection is?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I am not sure what a home inspection is all about.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I went there to check for problems with the home, so you aren't surprised when you move in.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: Wouldn't the owners have told me about any problems?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: Sellers aren't always truthful, and there might also be problems that they aren't aware of.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: Can I require the owners to fix the problems?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: You can make the sale of the house contingent on them fixing the problems.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: What did you find out when you did the inspection of my new home?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: There were no major problems. One leaky pipe under the sink and two broken roof tiles was all that I found.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: Can you tell me the results of my home inspection?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: Before I answer that, I want to make sure that you know what I was looking for. Are you clear on what I was looking for?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I never had a home inspection before.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I inspect the home for problems that might not be all that apparent in a quick walk-through.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I asked the owners, and they said that everything was great with the house.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: The owners might not be aware of everything wrong with the house. Some things are hidden, but might still be a problem for you in the future.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I heard that the owners must fix all of the problems before the escrow closes.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I inform you of the problems. If there are major problems, you can decline to buy the house or they may wish to fix any problems.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: What kinds of things did you discover in my home inspection?
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I found some fairly major problems. A major support beam in the roof is broken, and the shower floor leaked and rotted out the second-floor joist.
Subtopic: Discussing Home Inspection with an Inspector

TextEn: I help you spot potential problems with the home before you purchase it.

TextEn: The owner said that the roof had leaked, but that he got it fixed last month.

TextEn: Did you get a chance to speak with the sellers about my counter-offer?
Yes, and I think I have good news for you.
Did they accept the counter-offer?
Yes, they accepted your counter-offer, but they want you to pay for the home inspection.
How much will that cost?
It will cost you around five hundred to one thousand dollars for a home inspection.
Can I choose the home inspector?
Yes, you are paying for it, so you get to choose. I would pick the best one.
So, when are you going to inform the owners of my acceptance?
I will call the owners right now. They will be happy to hear the good news.
I was anxious to find out what the sellers had to say about my counter-offer.
I was able to contact them so, if you'll step into my office, we'll talk.
Did they go with the proposed counter-offer?
They want you to pick up the cost of the home inspection, but they accepted your offer.
Is a home inspection very expensive?
It can cost between five hundred and one thousand dollars.
Do I get to choose who inspects the home?
Yes, you get to choose. I would spend a little more to get a really thorough inspection.
Can you call the owners with my acceptance right away?
I am going to contact the sellers immediately. They were looking forward to your acceptance.
Were you able to contact the owners about my counter-offer?
Yes, please have a seat, and we'll discuss this right now.
I hope that they accepted the counter-offer.
The counter-offer was acceptable to them, but they want you to pay for the home inspection.
Will the home inspection cost me a lot?
It can cost as little as five hundred dollars and as much as one thousand dollars.
Is it my choice as to who inspects this house?
Yes, it is your choice as you are paying for it. Make a wise investment and choose the best inspector you can find.
How long until you contact the sellers with my acceptance?
Let's call them right now. I am sure that they will be happy to hear that you have agreed to pay for the inspection.
Have the owners come up with a counter-offer to my offer to buy their home yet?
The owners have counter-offered three hundred and thirty-five thousand dollars.
Should I accept their offer?
There are two ways to respond. You can either come back with another offer or go with their counter-offer.
What if I make another offer, and they don't accept it?
No one else has made an offer, so you could make another offer if you want to do so.
I think that I would like to offer three hundred and thirty thousand dollars as a counter-offer.
OK, I will present your counter-offer to the owners tonight.
How long before I find out what their decision is?
By now, the owners probably have a pretty good idea of what they will accept. It will go quickly.
Your office called and said that the owners had made a counter-offer to my offer to purchase their house.
To your offer of three hundred and twenty thousand dollars, the owners have counter-offered three hundred and thirty-five thousand dollars.
I think that maybe I should accept their offer.
You, of course, have two ways of responding. You can say yes or come up with another offer.
I want to make another offer, but I am afraid that they will decline and I will lose this house.
There is always a chance that someone could outbid you, but you could try one more offer if you like.
I would now like to offer three hundred and thirty thousand dollars as a counter-offer.
After the owners get home from work tonight, I will approach them with your offer.
Can you tell me how long it will take them to get back to me?
I don't think that it will take as long as the response to the first offer.
Have the owners answered back with a counter-offer for my offer to purchase the house?
In response to your offer, the sellers have decided to counter-offer three hundred and thirty-five thousand dollars.
That sounds pretty good to me, but I am not sure what to do.
You can accept this offer or decline it and come up with another offer.
If I make another offer and they refuse, then what?
Personally, I would consider making one more offer, but it is up to you to decide what to do.
Let's try going with three hundred and thirty thousand dollars for a counter-offer.
I will contact the sellers with your current offer.
Do you think that this will move along fairly quickly?
Usually the response to the second offer moves along a bit more quickly than the first one.
I am interested in buying a house and need some information.
Yes, of course. What area are you interested in?
I am interested in Pasadena or Arcadia.
What size house would you like?
We need a medium-sized house with at least 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms.
Are you interested in being in a particular school district?
Yes, we want to stay in the ABC School District.
Would you like a home near the lake or would you prefer a view?
I would love to have a home with a view.
Fine, I will begin a search for the perfect home for you. I will call you in a few days.
I would like to discuss purchasing a home with you.
I can help you. What location are you looking for?
I would like to live in Pasadena or Arcadia.
Have you thought about what your needs are in terms of size?
We would like a smaller cozy cottage with 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom.
Is living in a particular school district important to you?
No, we don't really care because they are all pretty good around here.
Are you interested in purchasing on the lake, or would you like a home with a view?
We really want to live in a lakeside home with a dock for our boat.
Now that I have an idea of what you want, I can begin my search.
I have been thinking of buying a house and would like to speak with you.
I have time to speak with you. Where would you like to purchase your house?
I am most interested in Pasadena or Arcadia, but would be open to other suggestions.
How many bedrooms and bathrooms do you need?
We have several generations of family living in our household and so need a very large home.
Do you need to be located in a particular school district?
It doesn't matter, as we do not have any children.
Is a view important to you, or would you rather be located on a lakeshore lot?
In a perfect world, we would like a home with a view of the lake.
Thank you for all of the information. I will help you find the perfect house for you.
I would like to make an offer on this house, but I don't know much about the process.
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: As your realtor, I am here to take care of this process. How much were you planning on offering?

TextEn: I have never done this before and don't know where to begin as far as making an offer on this house.
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: Leave the details of making the offer up to me. What were you thinking you should offer?

TextEn: I absolutely must have this house and will pay three hundred and fifty thousand dollars or more.

TextEn: It is best to start a little low on the first bid to allow for a counter-offer. How about offering three hundred and twenty thousand dollars?
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: I hope that the owners aren't insulted by that offer.
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: Your offering price is not out-of-line. The owners will either take it or make a counter-offer.
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: Does it usually take very long for the owners to get back to you with an acceptance?
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: It usually doesn't take very long for owners to respond to an offer.
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: Should I be in touch with my bank to tell them to get the loan papers ready?
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: The only thing you should do now is relax. You already are pre-qualified for your loan.
Subtopic: Making an Offer through a Realtor

TextEn: I need to see if I qualify for a home loan.
I can help you. How much money do you make per year?
I make around one hundred thousand dollars per year.
How long have you been on your current job?
I have only worked at this job for 6 months, but I have a longer job history elsewhere.
Do you have any other outside income from rental property or a trust?
No, I only receive my salary.
Do you know your credit score?
I think that it is around 600.
By crunching the numbers and putting in your expenses, I estimate that you can afford a house of around five hundred thousand dollars.
I am trying to see if I can afford to purchase a home that I wish to buy.
We can figure that out right now. How much do you earn annually?
My wife and I earned one hundred and fifty thousand dollars last year.
How many years have you held your current position?
I have been at my current job for 10 years.
Is there any extra income that you receive other than salary?
I collect one thousand dollars a month from a rental property.
Have you ever figured out your credit score?
I try not to think about it!
Adding in your expenses, I calculate that you can spend three hundred thousand on a house.
I want to go house shopping, and I want to know what I can afford to buy.
There is a formula that can help us figure that out. What is your annual salary?
I earn sixty-five thousand dollars per year.
What is the length of time that you have worked at the job you have now?
I have been at the job I now have for 2 years, and I have been with the company for 6 years total.
Do you receive any other income?
I own a small rental unit with a partner, and I receive five hundred dollars a month from that unit.
Do you know what your credit score is?
I don't know, but the last time I checked, it was very good!
You are in good shape. Figuring in your other expenses, you can easily afford a house costing seven hundred thousand or maybe even a little more!
I need help preparing for my presentation on Friday.
I could help you with that.
Are you sure you have the time?
I promise you that I have the time to do this. If I didn't, I wouldn't offer to help.
What would be the best time for you to help me?
Tomorrow night would work for me.
Should we just meet here?
OK, and I'll bring some information that helped me with my presentation.
I'll see you then.
See you tomorrow night.

I hate to ask you to do something like that.
This will not interfere with my work. I promise you that.
When could we get together?
I could easily give you some time tomorrow night.
Would you like to meet at the coffee house next door?
Yes, and could you write down anything you might be having trouble with?
I'll come prepared.
Goodbye until then. I promise you that you'll do well after we meet.
I am a little nervous about my presentation on Friday.
If you would like me to, I could help you with that.
Wouldn't that take you away from your project?
I have plenty of time to do this. I promise you it won't be a problem for me.
Is there a good time for you to help me?
If we work on this tomorrow night, you could easily be ready for Friday.
How about meeting in my office?
That would work out well. Bring any concerns that you might have.
Sounds like you'll be able to help me a lot.
Don't worry. Everything will go well. I promise!
Whoa, look at all those ice cream choices!
Yes, that is a lot of choices. What is your favorite?
I love anything with chocolate the best.
I like chocolate myself.
Is there any kind of ice cream you don't like?
I really don't like any ice cream with nuts in it.
I haven't ever cared for that myself.
Have you ever had garlic ice cream?
That sounds absolutely disgusting!
It was. Let's stick with the regular choices today, though.

Yes, there must be about a hundred. Do you have a favorite?
I love fruit flavored ices the best.
Yes, fresh fruit flavored is the best ever.
What is your least favorite ice cream?
I don't like peppermint ice cream.
Yes, I know what you mean.
One time, I tried garlic ice cream.
That could be interesting.
That doesn't sound like a good choice for today. Let's order!
I have never seen so many flavors of ice cream in one place!
There certainly are a lot. Can you choose a favorite?
Vanilla with toppings is my favorite.
Is there anything as good as a hot fudge sundae?
No way!
I don't like ice cream with too many different flavors in it.
I agree with that, it just doesn't work for me.
I saw garlic ice cream on the menu once.
I think that that would be horrible!
I think I'll stick with a more traditional choice today!
I was thinking about applying for the new position.
Do you think that is a good idea?
It seems like a good idea but I am not really sure.
What are your main concerns?
It would give me a chance to grow, but I am wondering if I would like the job.
I know what you mean, I've thought about that myself.
I also am thinking about the pay.
Could you take a slight pay decrease for a chance to move forward?
Yes, it might be worth it. I am not certain.
I think I'm convinced that trying for this position is the best choice for you.
I am not certain, but I think I might ask to be considered for the new job.
Why are you considering trying for it?
I think that I might like it, but I am still thinking about it.
What is it about this job that appeals to you?
I think that I would enjoy the position but there isn't a lot of creativity involved.
Yes, you could be right. There is a lot to consider.
I am also wondering about the pay.
Would a slight decrease in pay be worth it for a new opportunity for growth?
I am thinking that might be the case.
I think you should give it a shot. What do you have to lose? You can always change yourmind.
I am considering going for the new job that was posted yesterday.
Are you certain that that is what you want to do.
It may not be the best choice for me, but I am considering it.
Why do you think that this would be a good move?
I believe that this job would allow me to move up but might be a little boring for me.
Yes, there are always pros and cons to making a career change.
Also, the matter of pay is also a consideration.
I think the slight pay decrease might be worth it. The benefits are much better.
Yes, sometimes giving up a little to move forward is the best choice.
I think you definitely should apply for the position.
I was wondering if I could borrow the company van for a fundraiser this weekend.
Sure, I think that would be possible. Where is the fundraiser?
It is in the park downtown.
Would you need it for both Saturday and Sunday?
We will need it for Saturday only.
I think that would be OK. Who will be driving it?
Mary and I will be driving the van.
Could you drop it off on Sunday night?
Yes, we can do that. Can we borrow the chairs from the lunchroom also?
Yes, that would be fine. Just make sure that everything is returned by Sunday night.
Our unit is participating in a fundraiser this weekend and would like to borrow the van, if possible.
I would need to check on that. Where is the fundraiser?
It will be at the beach by the pier.
What day will you need it for?
We will only be needing it for Sunday.
Maybe that could work. I need to know who will be driving it.
The only two drivers will be Mary and I.
If I give you the keys to the garage, could you bring it back on Sunday evening?
Sure. We also would like to use the chairs from the lunchroom. Would that be OK?
OK, but make sure that everything is back by Sunday night at the latest.
Could we borrow the company van for a fundraiser this weekend?
That would be a possibility. Where is this fundraiser taking place?
It is in the hotel ballroom down the street.

We will need it for both days.

Just keep track of everything and get it all back where you took it from by Sunday evening.

Fine, I'll put you down for that.
That would be great!
Happy I could help you; see you then!

OK, just tell me what day would be best for your appointment.

Great, I'll just add you in, if that works.

TextEn: I need help figuring out how to use this phone.
Sure. First you pick up the receiver and hit one of the first 3 buttons. Do you hear a tone?
Yes, I hear the tone.
OK. Now you dial 9 on the keypad. Do you hear the tone change?
Yes, it changed.
Well, when you hear it change, that means you have an outside line. Where are you trying to call?
I am trying to call home.
OK. Well, to dial to the outside you just now dial the number. For a call inside the company just hit the extension number. Do you know the extensions?
Yes, I have a list of extensions.
Well, if you ever need help with an extension, you can dial O.
Can you show me how to use this phone?
Yes, I can help you with that. Pick up the receiver and hit one of the buttons. Do you hear a tone?
No, I don't hear anything.
Next you dial 9 on the keypad. You should hear the tone change. Did you hear it change?
I'm not sure.
OK. Well, after you get the line to change you have an outside line. Who are you trying to call?
I am trying to call a client.
To call a number on the outside you now just dial the number. For inside calls, punch in the extension number. Has someone given you an extension list?
No, I don't know anyone's extension.
All of the extensions are listed on the wall chart over there if you ever need help.
I want to make a phone call. Can you show me how?
Of course, pick up the receiver, hit a button and listen for a tone. Are you hearing it?
Yes, now what do I do?
Well, after you dial 9 on the keypad, you should hear the tone change.
No, nothing changed.
When you dial 9 and hear the tone change it means you have an outside line. Who are you trying to call?
I am trying to call my boss.
For an outside call you now just dial the number. For a company number you need to know the extension. Do you have a list of extensions?
I know a few extensions but I don't know all of them.
You can always look an extension up on the company website.
Can you help me with my timesheet?
Sure! I can help you. Do you know where the timesheets are kept?
No, I don't know where to find one.
Well, once you get one off the shelf over there, you first put your name on it. OK?
Yes, I can do that.
Now you have to fill in the hours in the blanks and total the hours for the week. Do you know how to use military time?
No, I don't know what that is.
OK, so we just start counting hours at midnight and record it. Show all minutes as a dot and then write how many minutes. OK?
Yes, I understand how to do this.
After you total your hours, make sure you sign it and turn it in to your supervisor.
That was easy!
Good luck and let me know if you need any help later on.
How do we do timesheets here?
They are actually fairly straightforward. Do you know where the blanks are kept?
Yes, I already have one.
OK, well after you take one out of that second drawer, you put your name on the top. Do you see?
I am kind of confused.
Next you fill in all of your hours for each day and total them. Do you know how to show time on a 24-hour clock?
I'm not quite sure.
Midnight is zero and when you put the minutes in, make sure that you show them with a dot followed by the minutes. Do you understand?
No, I have no idea what you are talking about.
It's easy, just write in the hours, total it, sign it, and put it in the box.
Thanks for your help.
Try it and if you can't do it, one of us can always help you later.
I need help with my timesheet.
OK, no problem. Have you found the blank ones?
Yes, I have seen them.
Yes, well put your name on it after you have downloaded it off the company website. OK?
Yes, I understand what to do.
You fill in the hours and total them for the week. Have you ever used a 24 hour clock?
What? Huh?
So after you noted the hours, starting at zero which is midnight, you just write down the minutes as a dot followed by minutes. Get it?
Huh? What?
Just make sure you show your total, sign it, and turn it in.
I thought you said this was easy.
You are a quick learner. I don't think you'll have any trouble with this.
Is there anything I can help?
Subtopic: Responding to a Plea for Help
